Reviews.Title: Good deal; reasonably good TV.
Reviews.Author: Stan Black
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Great price. I had never heard of UpStar previously, but, we were looking for a size down from a 55 inch monster in our 1 bedroom apartment. You can't beat it for less than 200 dollars. One issue is with color; it takes some tweaks to the color to not have the orange peel faces. But, otherwise, great and as expected.

Reviews.Title: Dead pixels, confusing specs.
Reviews.Author: Adrian E. Garay
Reviews.Content: Good picture, although ours came with a dead pixel right smack in the middle.  Though not distracting enough to bother us for a return, I would imagine most would not be happy if this were common.The specs are slightly misleading.  Upstar's website lists this model as having a 1080p panel, and oddly enough the television does recognize the mode displaying a MODE:1080P when fed a 1080 signal.  After much scrutiny, I've concluded It does in fact *not* support 1080p, it is actually compressed with terrible interpolation.  It will, however, allow you to play back such a signal which has to be worth something!I was hoping Amazon made a mistake listing this as 720p, but in the end I received what I paid for and am ultimately happy with the purchase at this price.
